messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Digest Number 694
messages.msgSnippet: Guys , Thank  you  very much  for the  interesting replies. I think  I have a  fake or  a very  nice  tanto. At the moment I  still have hope but I did
messages.messageBody:
Guys ,
Thank you very much for the interesting replies. I think I have a fake or a very nice tanto. At the moment I still have hope but I did purchase it in china???? and the more I read about swords on these brilliant sites the more I think i am heading for tears.

The serial number (in english) is descreetly placed on the saya (scabbord) on the Koiguchi (mouth of the scabbord) which appears to be brass. You cannot see it when the tanto is in the scabbord.

The blade lenght is 10.4 inches the overall lenght is 17.9 inches.
There is a mei on the tang. With the use of another site I managed to make out the swords smith name as Nagimistsu? Nagamitsu? (two kangi). On the other side of the tang there are four kangi, I did not find out what they are , I assume the date?)

Its the saya is covered in sharkskin, as is the Suka which appears to be wraped around a wooden handle


I suppose it would be easier to post a picture is that allowed?



Any way Guys once again thank you for the replies

David




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
